017package de.mnl.osgi.log.fwd2jul;
018
019import java.util.Collections;
020import java.util.List;
021import org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator;
022import org.osgi.framework.BundleContext;
023import org.osgi.framework.ServiceReference;
024import org.osgi.service.log.LogEntry;
025import org.osgi.service.log.LogReaderService;
026import org.osgi.util.tracker.ServiceTracker;
027
028/**
029 * This class provides the activator for this service. It registers
030 * (respectively unregisters) the {@link LogWriter} as LogListener 
031 * for for all log reader services and forwards any already existing 
032 * log entries to it. 
033 *
034 * @deprecated Replaced by {@code de.mnl.osgi.osgi2jul}.
035 */
036public class Activator implements BundleActivator {
037
038    /** This tracker holds all log reader services. */
039    private ServiceTracker<LogReaderService, LogReaderService> serviceTracker
040        = null;
041    /** The log listener that forwards to java.util.logging. */
042    private LogWriter logWriter = new LogWriter();
043
044    /**
045     * Open the log service tracker. The tracker is customized to attach the 
046     * LogWriter to all registered log reader services (and detach it on 
047     * un-registration, of course). Already existing log entries 
048     * are forwarded to the LogWriter as well. No provisions have been
049     * taken to avoid the duplicate output that can occur if a message
050     * is logged between registering the LogWriter and forwarding
051     * stored log entries.
052     */
053    @Override
054    public void start(BundleContext context) throws Exception {
055        serviceTracker = new ServiceTracker<LogReaderService, LogReaderService>(
056            context, LogReaderService.class, null) {
057
058            @Override
059            public LogReaderService addingService(
060                    ServiceReference<LogReaderService> reference) {
061                LogReaderService service = super.addingService(reference);
062                service.addLogListener(logWriter);
063                // We don't check for duplicate log entries. It can happen
064                // that an entry is forwarded twice. A new entry might be
065                // handled by the LogWriter registered above and go into
066                // the log entry store before we have copied its content
067                // below. As log entries haven't got unique ids (as in
068                // java.util.logging) we'd have to compare all properties
069                // in order to identify duplicates.
070                // But it is not very probable that this happens and having
071                // an identical entry twice isn't as bad as loosing one.
072                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
073                List<LogEntry> entries = Collections.list(service.getLog());
074                Collections.reverse(entries);
075                for (LogEntry entry : entries) {
076                    logWriter.logged(entry);
077                }
078                return service;
079            }
080
081            @Override
082            public void removedService(
083                    ServiceReference<LogReaderService> reference,
084                    LogReaderService service) {
085                super.removedService(reference, service);
086                service.removeLogListener(logWriter);
087            }
088
089        };
090        serviceTracker.open();
091    }
092
093    @Override
094    public void stop(BundleContext context) throws Exception {
095        serviceTracker.close();
096        serviceTracker = null;
097    }
098
099}
